txt.en: Instance: Council of the Seven
'And if not?'
'Will we simply sit by if victory comes without woe?'
'What of the Iron Hills?'
'Surely we will not be kept idle.'
'Come on!'
'Drógar and Agni, you shall lead your warriors onto the slopes of Zirakzigil.'
'Zirakazhâr is overrun, and it must be reclaimed.'
'Vélat and Usk, your warriors must cross Kibil-nâla and climb the slopes of Bundushâthur.'
'If the Orcs hold the warding-spire, none of our movements in the dale will go beneath their notice.'
'Jegín, the Temámir shall aid the Landorrim and Narfanghoth at Zirakazhâr.'
'As for your keen-eyed scouts, let them learn what they might of Azog's designs.'
'Not only the sons, but the father also!'
'Shâlim, you will send half of your warriors to Atrad-zarakh to bolster the Kámbrada and Zhélruka.'
'I will not sit by, playing the dotard, while the blades of others drink their fill.'
'The rest will assemble along the outer edges of the dale.'
'If any Orcs mean to escape our wrath, the Abnúzhu will slay them to the last.'
'We come to it at last.'
'We will walk the Great-way proudly as our forefathers did.'
'Too long has my father's shade awaited what the morrow brings.'
'And we shall meet the Orcs in battle from Amdân to the very gates of Khazad-dûm!'
'Too long has the defilement of his body gone unanswered.'
'My sons and I will lead the vanguard and the sons of Farin will march beside us.'
'Too long has the coward Azog hidden in our ancient home, his hands stained with noble blood.'
'Not idle, cousin, but in reserve.'
'And so, he sent his sons to fight in his stead.'
'The Iron-folk will answer the horn-calls of the others, should any part of the battle turn wrongly.'
'A great battle awaits us at Azanulbizar.'
'There was Komog, who fell in the halls of Gundabad, and whose skull now adorns my banner.'
'Indeed, my son.'
'All will be ordered as I and the other Kings of the Seven Houses have resolved.'
'Then, there was Urro, the eldest, whose hand was severed by my son, Frerin.'
'Let those questions be answered on the morrow.'
'For tonight, let us sleep while we may.'
'And then, there was Bolg, who fled from battle. The line of Azog is spent.'
'For we shall not rest again until Azog is slain!'
'Pray, cousin, when has that ever come to pass?'
'For nine long years he has eluded us, but no longer!'
'Baruk Khazâd! Khazâd ai-mênu!'
'Too long.'
'For Thrór!'
'What of you and your kin, Thráin?'
